title: US Election 2020: Meet the voters behind Bloomberg's surge
description: The New York billionaire has qualified for the next debate. So who are his supporters?

title: Caroline Flack death: Will people now 'be kind' in the media and online?
description: The presenter's death has prompted calls for people to "be kind" on social media and in the press.

title: Chris Martin: Early recording of Coldplay star to be auctioned
description: The 1989 cassette features the Coldplay star performing aged 12 in a school music competition.

title: 'An operation's not for me, thanks' - Kenny opts against surgery on broken shoulder
description: Four-time Olympic champion Laura Kenny chooses not to have surgery on a broken shoulder so she can ride at the Track World Championships next week.

title: Son Heung-min: Jose Mourinho's unusual reaction to Tottenham's injury concerns
description: Tottenham Hotspur manager Jose Mourinho gives a unusual stairway analogy when asked about Son Heung-min's arm injury.

title: Plymouth Rock: Mayflower monument covered in graffiti
description: It was one of several monuments in Plymouth that was vandalised on Monday morning.

title: Andrew Sabisky: What is superforecasting?
description: The idea that came out of a US competition to improve the way we predict world events.

title: 'My horse knew I had brain cancer before I did'
description: A woman tells how her beloved pet kept sniffing the right side of her head before two brain tumours were diagnosed.

title: Nasa's 2020 rover: Can we finally answer the big question about Mars?
description: The US space agency's next rover will hunt for life's traces among the rocks of the Red Planet.

title: Storm Dennis: Fears for Severn towns amid fresh flood warnings
description: Residents in communities on the river are being evacuated as water threatens to top flood defences.

title: Bloomberg to join Democratic debate amid poll surge
description: The former New York mayor has qualified to take part in a Democratic debate for the first time.

title: Son Heung-min: Tottenham forward out for 'number of weeks' with fractured arm
description: Tottenham forward Son Heung-min will be sidelined for a "number of weeks" after fracturing his arm during Sunday's 3-2 win at Aston Villa.

title: England's Vunipola to miss Ireland game for family reasons
description: England prop Mako Vunipola will miss Sunday's Six Nations game against Ireland after returning to Tonga for family reasons.

title: West Ham defender Fisk named in young England squad
description: England Women's coach Phil Neville gives Grace Fisk her first senior call-up as he names a young squad for their SheBelieves Cup defence in March.

title: Coronavirus: British couple on cruise ship 'test positive'
description: The UK government says it is trying to rescue British nationals from the quarantined cruise ship.

title: Coronavirus: The noted victims of the virus in Wuhan
description: A bodybuilder, a watercolour artist and a film director are amongst those who have died in Wuhan.

title: Andrew Sabisky: No 10 urged to examine vetting after aide quits
description: A minister calls past remarks by Andrew Sabisky "racist", but he accuses the media of "selective quoting".

title: Wages back above pre-economic crisis levels
description: Average wages - when adjusted for inflation - exceed pre-crisis levels for the first time since 2008.

title: Australia bushfires: Backpackers can stay longer if they help rebuild
description: New rules have been introduced so that people with working holiday visas can extend their stay.

title: The converging art careers of Henry Moore and Bill Brandt
description: Henry Moore and Bill Brandt created images of civilians sheltering during the Blitz.

title: HSBC signals mass job cuts as profits plunge
description: Interim chief executive Noel Quinn reveals extensive job cuts and restructuring to shake up the bank.

title: British radio antenna arrives at space station
description: The UK's first industrial contribution to the orbiting platform will improve its communication links.

title: Knight disappointed as Sri Lanka shock England in warm-up game
description: Captain Heather Knight hopes England can put their shock warm-up defeat by Sri Lanka behind them as they prepare for the Women's T20 World Cup.

title: Wilder points win in Las Vegas is impossible – Fury
description: Tyson Fury says Deontay Wilder cannot win on points when the pair meet for the world heavyweight title in Las Vegas on Saturday.

title: Billie Eilish on Bond and online bullying
description: In an exclusive interview with the BBC, the singer speaks ahead of her performance at the Brit Awards.

title: Cambridge University don wrote erotic fiction about students
description: Dr Peter Hutchinson wrote the book the same year sexual harassment complaints were made against him.

title: Newspaper headlines: Brexit trade speech and No 10 adviser resigns
description: Tuesday's newspapers include reports of the UK's chief Brexit negotiator's speech in Brussels.

title: Brit Awards 2020: Behind-the-scenes of an after-party
description: How do you plan an after-party for the biggest stars in music?

title: Steve Coogan: We ignore the imbalance between rich and poor
description: The Alan Partridge star takes on the retail industry in his new film Greed.

title: No putting meat on expenses, says property firm
description: Developers Igloo Regeneration has gone vegetarian to cut its environmental impact.

title: Russian activist Anastasia Shevchenko living under house arrest
description: Anastasia Shevchenko is facing six years in prison for her opposition political activism.

title: Julian Assange: Father fears 'worried' son's extradition
description: John Shipton said Wikileaks founder Julian Assange had felt "ceaseless anxiety" over the past decade.

title: FW de Klerk and the South African row over apartheid and crimes against humanity
description: A row over comments by South Africa's last white president, FW de Klerk, reopens old wounds.

title: How are weather forecasts made?
description: Extreme weather events are happening around the world regularly and forecasts can help people prepare.

title: The unlikely friendship saving Egypt’s synagogues
description: Magda, who is Jewish, and Marwa, who is Palestinian and Muslim, are driving a push to rescue Egypt's Jewish heritage.

title: Why your new work colleague could be a robot
description: Better sight, better hands and more intelligence are allowing robots to take on more and more jobs.

title: Woman 'conceived by rape' claim leads to arrest
description: "Vicky" alleges her mother was aged 13, under the age of consent, when her father raped her.

title: Should organ donors be paid? The heavy toll of US kidney shortage
description: Thousands of Americans die from kidney failure each year, but efforts to find organ donors remain contentious.

title: Transgender patients self-medicating over NHS waits
description: One woman, who has waited over two years to be seen, said it had left her suicidal.
